meanings.definition: Bitterness or resentfulness, especially when long-standing.
meanings.sent1: The rancors between the two neighbors were evident in their cold glares.
meanings.sent2: The rancors in her heart towards her former friend slowly faded with time.
meanings.sent3: The rancors over the last piece of cake at the party led to a playful food fight.
meanings.sent4: The rancors in her voice cut through the room like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The rancors in the air were so thick you could almost taste them.

meanings.sent1: She rancors every time she thinks about the unfair treatment she received.
meanings.sent2: He rancors towards his boss for not appreciating his hard work.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to rancors when the new kitten invaded its territory.
meanings.sent4: His heart rancors with every unkind word spoken to him.
meanings.sent5: The bitterness in her tone clearly rancors towards her ex-boyfriend.
